page.title: 04ADDERLEY CANAL LOCKS
page.content: Mr Butter has looked after the locks since 1979.He used to be a farm worker and it was a challenge for him to come and work on the locks.He looks after 4 miles of water from Wests Bridge to Bettonwood.The towpath is clean all the time.He has to do a lot of work to keep them tidy.He has to keep the rabbits out so they wont burrow into the canal and cause flooding.He greases the collars of the paddles so that they open easily.The locks are made out of Elm because they wont rot as quickly but the beams are made out of Oak.They should last fifty years and were last replaced in 1975.In Mr Butters stretch each lock drops 6 feet.He has 6 locks to look after.
